means: 不同的，相异的，不一致的

word_mean: 变异体，变型，变种：与所属的种类在某些特点上有不同的，如疾病、特质或种的变型

sentence.Network_en: There are so many variant spellings of his name.
sentence.Network_cn: 他的名字有很多不同的拼写形式。

sentence.Network_en: This game is a variant of baseball.
sentence.Network_cn: 这种运动是由棒球演变而来的。

sentence.Network_en: Semasiology is a variant name for semantics.

高尔夫旅行轿车（golf variant），一款提倡型尚休闲生活的多功能旅行轿车，外观造型的简洁质感、经济平顺的驾驶享受与灵活宽敞 …

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (as an adjective in the sense 'tending to vary'): from Old French, literally varying', present participle of varier (see vary). The noun dates from the mid 19th cent

entry.def: A variant of a particular thing is something that has a different form to that thing, although it is related to it.

example.ex: The quagga was a strikingly beautiful variant of the zebra...
example.tran: 斑驴是一种极美丽的斑马变种。

example.ex: An intriguing variant to pipelines would be to carry the water using the existing system of canals...
example.tran: 除用管道外，利用现有的运河系统来输送水也很值得一试。

means.word_mean: 1. an event that departs from expectations
2. (biology) a group of organisms within a species that differ in trivial ways from similar groups;
3. a variable quantity that is random
4. something a little different from others of the same type;

sentences.sentence: "an experimental version of the night fighter"
"an emery wheel is a modern variant of the grindstone"
"the boy is a younger edition of his father"

means.word_mean: 1. differing from a norm or standard;
